postsData.name:
Leslie Venetz
Leslie Venetz
postsData.content:
I’ve spent 15+ years in B2B sales. 
Here are 15 things I wish I learned sooner.



It’s not about you
Set boundaries early
Data beats gut instinct
Some customers are jerks
Your job title isn’t your worth
Stop trying to sell to everyone
It’s not a weakness to ask for help
Your network is your greatest asset
Don't sell a product, solve a problem
Your time is as valuable as the prospects
Burnout isn’t worth the salary you’re paid
Timing can be the difference between yes and no
Never underestimate the power of a great follow-up
If you wait for what you’re "owed" you’ll never get what you want


 What's the most important lesson you've learned?

comments.commentText: What's the most important lesson you've learned?

Yep with my favorite being "your network is your greatest asset." To be clear, in my case those were folks I sold along with and had moved on to other positions in the industry. Riffed - Barry called after championing me with his VP Sales. Resigned - same for Bill who found a (sweet) spot for me on his team. Thanks, dudes.
Richard Spanier that’s a really good one. Networking really pays.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Your network is your greatest asset truly resonates with me. Its all about building relationships. Whats your favorite takeaway?

postsData.name:
Costas K. G.
Costas K. G.
postsData.content:
You don’t need to hate Mondays.

What you need is a shift in perspective.
A reason to see them differently.

Mondays aren’t a burden.
They’re a launchpad.
A starting line.
The first push in a row of dominoes.

Momentum starts with:
- Clarity of purpose
- A strong first step
- The right mindset

When the first domino falls strong, the rest follow effortlessly.

Because:
Your week doesn’t shape Monday.
Monday shapes your week.

Think of your Growth journey as the days of the week.

Here is how to do this:

1. Monday → The spark.
- The start of something new.
- Exciting, but uncertain.
- The idea takes root.

2. Tuesday → The first push.
- You start building.
- You test, organize, and adjust.
- The vision gets clearer.

3. Wednesday → The grind.
- The honeymoon phase fades.
- Doubt creeps in.
- This is where resilience kicks in.

4. Thursday → The breakthrough.
- Confidence grows.
- Lessons shape your direction.
- You adjust, refine, and push forward.

5. Friday → The reward.
- Wins start showing.
- You remember why you started.
- Momentum builds.

6. Saturday → The reflection.
- You pause and look back.
- The progress feels real.
- You see how far you’ve come.

7. Sunday → The recharge.
- Rest. Recover. Reset.
- You take in the lessons.
- And get ready to start again, stronger.

Each day teaches you.
Each day moves you forward.

Make Monday work for you.

It’s not just another day.
It’s the starting spark.
The ignition for what’s ahead.

One strong move today fuels a powerful week.

Don’t just get through it.
Own it. Use it. Thrive.

---

P.S. – This image is copyrighted. Please ask for permission before using it.

Repost ️ if you find this useful.
Hit the  if you enjoy my content.

comments.commentText: Nice twist on Monday dread. Mondays are a launchpad. But hey, why not make Sundays the new Monday?
Sven Elstermann Love that! Starting strong on Sunday can give Monday an even bigger boost. A little head start can make all the difference!

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely love this perspective! Mondays really can be the launchpad for an incredible week ahead. Lets embrace the momentum! 🚀

postsData.name:
Wouter Dieleman
Wouter Dieleman
postsData.content:
How to use SPICED in ABM and Enterprise selling 

What is SPICED? A framework that helps GTM teams diagnose customer needs and have more impactful conversations. Review image 8, 9 and 10.

It's developed by'sin his book Revenue Architecture:

[𝗦]ituation: Leads to pain ⤵️
[𝗣]ain: Drives the necessity for change or impact ⤵️
[𝗜]mpact: Is needed to adhere to a critical event ⤵️
[𝗖]ritical [𝗘]vent: Determines decision making ⤵️
[𝗗]ecision: Is based on Decision Criteria & Process used in ME𝗗𝗗IC

Why is it especially suitable for Enterprise selling? Because you're multi-threading. Talking to multiple stakeholders in your target account's buying committee.

Identifying their individual needs, critical events and decision criteria is essential for your ABM success.

7 steps to use SPICED in ABM and Enterprise selling:

1. Map it to Tier 1/2 ICPs to diagnose these segment's needs [image 1]
2. Use SPICED to select target accounts [image 2]
3. Map SPICED phases to your buying committee members [image 3]
4. Drill down into the personas of your T1/2 buying committee and map SPICED to key roles [image 4 & 5]
5. Incorporate the criteria in your discovery call playbooks [image 6]
6. [Optional] Develop customer stories based on SPICED [image 6]
7. Develop account plans based on SPICED [image 7, 8 & 9]

Tips/context:

• Don't invent it all yourself. Especially step 4 is heavy on creation. Leverage AI. I used's and's custom GTM ChatGPT to help describe SPICED for personas. Link in 1st comment.
• Start small. If the steps feel overwhelming start with mapping SPICED to ICP [image 2] and input that data into GTM GPT to develop SPICED for main personas [image 4]
• Remember that every SPICED step you include is an incremental gain that will compound over time. If 6 months from you include 80% of this you'll increase your win rates no question.

Would love to hear from my network how you leverage SPICED. What is the most practical application for people to start with?

The spreadsheet screenshots are part of my ABM worksheet. High-ACV B2B SaaS  come find me in DM or the comments for a copy

comments.commentText: Custom GTM GPT bij Koen and Simon: https://chatgpt.com/g/g-txsNDSXtL-go-to-market-knowledge-library-by-simon-koen

My knowledge and passion for the subject of Revenue Architecture has increased substantially since I joined the Pavilion commnunity. They have a direct partnership with Winning by Design for the Revenue Architecture which I've completed in January.

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights on using SPICED in ABM! Mapping to ICPs sounds like a solid starting point. Excited to see how others are applying this! #ABM #SalesStrategy

postsData.name:
Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
postsData.content:
How I Automated My Calendar and Got 10-Hours of My Life Back Every Week...

"Your calendar isn’t just a schedule, it’s a silent killer of productivity..."

Here's how I got my time back...

I used to live in my inbox, drowning in:
- Back-and-forth emails to schedule meetings
- Double-booked meetings that killed my focus
- Endless admin work instead of high-impact selling

Sound familiar?

Then, I found AI-powered calendar automation. It changed everything.
Here’s how you can do the same and reclaim your time.

Step 1: Get an AI Scheduling Assistant

The problem: Salespeople spend on average 6+ hours a week just scheduling meetings. That's wasted selling time.

The fix: Use an AI-powered scheduler like Reclaim, Motion, or Calendly.

Here's what it does:
 Suggests available time slots automatically
 Syncs across time zones
 Reschedules meetings without your involvement

Pro Tip: Set “Priority blocks” for deep work so AI knows when not to book other tasks that are less important...

Step 2: Let AI Handle Follow-Ups & No-Shows

The problem: 30% of sales calls get ghosted, and chasing people down eats up valuable time.

The fix: AI tools like Salesloft, Outreach, and Superhuman send:
 Automated reminders & rescheduling links
 Follow-ups with personalized messages
 Post-meeting summaries using AI-generated insights

Pro Tip: Train AI to recognize when a lead is hot or cold so it adjusts your follow-up cadence automatically.

Step 3: Use AI to Optimize Your Day for Peak Performance

The problem: Most sales pros cram meetings into random slots, leading to burnout & context switching.

The fix: AI calendar tools analyze your peak productivity hours and:
 Batch calls into focus-friendly blocks
 Set aside deep work periods for strategy & prospecting
 Prevent overbooking so you stay sharp

Step 4: AI-Generated Insights to Improve Future Meetings

The problem: Most sales teams make decisions based on gut feelings, not data. (Big Problem)

The fix: AI tools like Gong, Chorus, and Fireflies:

 Analyze meeting transcripts for objections & buying signals
 Suggest better ways to handle pricing discussions
 Identify patterns in successful vs. failed deals

 Pro Tip: Set up AI alerts for when prospects show high buying intent, so you never miss a closing opportunity...

Final Thoughts: What Happens When You Automate Your Calendar?
After implementing this, my schedule stopped running me. I started running it and here's what happened:

 10+ hours saved weekly
 More time spent selling, not scheduling
 Higher energy & focus on revenue-driving activities

Sales is about building relationships, not playing calendar Tetris.

Now, tell me, how much time is your calendar stealing from you?
---
️ Share this post with a sales leader who needs to hear it. Follow me for more strategies to grow your team and results.

 Click here: Follow me on LinkedIn:
Join our community of 30,000+ sales professionals today!
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Automating my calendar has been a game-changer. Cheers to more time for what truly matters in sales! 🚀 #Productivity

postsData.name:
Saadat Najafova
Saadat Najafova
postsData.content:
Most presentations suck.

DeepSeek can help you create stunning presentations for free.

Here’s how:

1. Catchy Titles
Prompt: "Suggest some attention-grabbing, catchy titles for my work presentation to draw in my audience, who will consist of [job titles]."

2. Outline for PPT
Prompt: "I am a [job title] presenting to [job titles of audience] for the purpose of [objective of presentation]. Give me an outline for this PowerPoint presentation, [title], which will last 15 minutes. Keep it to no more than 12 slides."

3. Starter Punch
Prompt: "Provide some ideas for starting my presentation with a bang, including attention-grabbing opening slides. (Once it provides the answer, write this prompt:) Repeat the above with this presentation [title] in mind."

4. Ideas
Prompt: "Generate a list of ideas for supplementary handouts and resources to complement my presentation."

5. Questions
Prompt: "How can I handle or field questions about my presentation from the audience of stakeholders effectively and confidently?"

6. Design Suggestions
Prompt: "How can I strike the right balance between text and visuals to keep my slides visually appealing and informative?"

7. Improve Readability
Prompt: "Give me a list of techniques for improving readability through choosing appropriate fonts, sizes, and text formatting for my work presentation."

8. Quizzes & Interaction
Prompt: "Explore some ways that I can make my presentation interactive through quizzes, polls, and audience participation."

9. Introducing New Ideas
Prompt: "Suggest some ways I can introduce and present the concept of [name of concept] to a non-technical audience."

10. Main Points
Prompt: "What key points should I cover in a presentation about [name of topic]?"

11. Relevant Topic Icebreakers
Prompt: "Provide a list of topic-relevant icebreakers that I can use to kick off my presentation on [name of topic], which will be suitable for the 30 team members who will be attending."

12. Storytelling
Prompt: "Suggest some ways I can include storytelling in my presentation."

What’s your go-to AI prompt for presentations?

P.S.

Sneha Goyal
Sneha Goyal
postsData.content:
Reflecting on our participation in Hackathon 2025 "INNOVERSE' 36", hosted by Atal Community Innovation Center-SGT University and SGT UNIVERSITY . However, we humbly acknowledge that we did not secure the position this time. However, we view this outcome as a stepping stone towards growth and improvement.

My first hackathon with my team(,,,) was an absolute whirlwind of an experience. From the initial brainstorming sessions, fueled by copious amounts of caffeine and snacks, to the late-night coding sprints, the energy was infectious. We faced our fair share of challenges, from debugging nightmares to moments where we thought our project was doomed, but we tackled each obstacle together. The camaraderie and support within the team were incredible; everyone brought their unique skills to the table, and we learned so much from each other along the way. While sleep was a distant memory and the pressure was on, the thrill of creating something from scratch in such a short timeframe was exhilarating. Seeing our project come to life, even in its prototype form, was incredibly rewarding, and the sense of accomplishment we shared as a team made all the late nights and frantic coding totally worth it. I'm already looking forward to the next hackathon and the opportunity to build and learn even more with this amazing team.

We also got the opportunity to meet the guest speaker of that eventandand get motive by their speaks.They share their great experience with us. Special thanks tosir for this hackathon.

We sincerely thank theand Faculty of Engineering & Technology- SGT University for hosting this fantastic hackathon. It was an invaluable experience, providing us with a platform to collaborate, innovate, and learn. We appreciate the university's commitment to fostering a strong tech community and providing the resources that made this event a success. Thank you for investing in our future.


#

comments.commentText: Amazing!

postsData.commentAdded: What an inspiring journey! Your resilience and teamwork truly shine through. Excited to see what you all create next! 🚀 #Hackathon2025

postsData.content:
Eicher Motors: Engineering Excellence, Driving the Future








Eicher motors Ltd. Was incorporated in year 1982.
Eicher motors limited (EML) is an Indian, multinational automative company that has diversified interest in motar cycle and commercial vehicle manufacturing.
The commercial production as commenced in their plant at Pithampur in madhya pradesh with the launch of canter truck in 1986.
The demerger of tractors , two-wheelers Engines and gears business from Eicher Ltd transferred to company with effect from April 2003.
In may 2008 , the company signed a definitive agreement with aktiebolge volvo.
In 2013 VECV Eicher trucks and buses division (ETB) launched the Indian trucking with “pro series” range trucks and buses from 5-49 tonnes and 15 to 65 bus seater.
EML 50-50 joint venture with the sweden AB volvo
VECV engaged in truck and bus operations , auto components business and technical consulting services business.,VE commercial vehicle limited (VECV).


Business verticals :-
Royal Enfield -
Company manufactures and markets motorcycle under the “Royal Enfield” brand
It also offers apparel for mena and women like protective riding apparel , urban casual wear and riding accessories.
VE comercial vehicle (VECV)-
Is an Indian, multinational automative company that has diversified interest in motar cycle and commercial vehicle manufacturing.
VECV engaged in truck and bus operations , auto components business and technical consulting services business.

Geographical split :-
Domestic: 88% in FY24 v/s 83% in FY22
Export. : 12% in FY 24 v/s 17% in FY22
In March 2024 company set up a new WOS( wholly owned subsidiary) in Netherlands it has also expanded its operations to Turkey in 2024

Distribution Network :-
Royal Enfield over 2,000 stores
Indian - 1,085 stores in and more than 60 countries worldwide
VECV retail network comprised almost 1,000 showroom

Manufacturing facility :-
Chennai with total production capacity of 12 lakh motorcycle per annum operate at 77% capacity.
VEVC manufacturing plant in Pithampur madhya pradesh with capacity of 90,000 vehicles per year.
A new facility in bhopal has an initial capacity of 40,000 trucks per year scalable to 1,00,000.

Capex :-
Company established a CKD (assembly unit ) in Nepal in FY24 with capacity of 20,000 units to serve nepal and SAARC ( South Asian Association for regional cooperation).
CKD units plans in Bangladesh and will begin operations from FY25 onward.

comments.commentText: Ai genarated images.
Useful information

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting journey for Eicher Motors! Impressive growth and innovation in both motorcycles and commercial vehicles. Looking forward to what’s next! 🚀

postsData.name:
Kiran Babu
Kiran Babu
postsData.content:
Comprehensive GCC Legal & Regulatory Updates 

Here’s a detailed overview of recent impactful developments across the region:

1. Bahrain: A groundbreaking legislative proposal aims to impose stricter penalties for privacy violations, including imprisonment and hefty fines. This move seeks to deter unauthorized invasions of personal privacy, underlining Bahrain's commitment to safeguarding individual rights.


2. UAE: Artificial Intelligence is making its way into the judiciary system. Trials are underway to leverage AI for case analysis, focusing on clear-cut cases requiring no human discretion. Beyond rulings, AI is streamlining legal processes by translating, summarizing, and analyzing massive volumes of documents—making legal systems faster and more efficient.


3. Sharjah: A new HR law for military personnel introduces changes to promotions and retirements, along with the creation of a Police Judiciary Council. Key updates include:

- Regulatory committees will oversee promotions and retirements to ensure criteria are met.
- Higher-rank promotions/retirements require Ruler approval; lower ranks handled internally.
- The Police Judiciary Council will review violations and impose penalties, subject to final ratification.


4. Oman: The State Council and Majlis Al Shura have approved draft personal income tax laws with adjustments. Key highlights:

- A tax exemption limit raised to RO 50,000 to support the middle class.
- Gratuity and end-of-service benefits excluded from taxable income.
- Salaries above RO 2,500/month will be taxed, impacting around 32,000 individuals based on prior studies.


5. Qatar: The Ministry of Justice has unveiled cutting-edge digital services for real estate. The updated Sak Application now facilitates issuing replacement deeds, correcting property details, and managing mortgages. With QR codes integrated into deeds, property information is easily accessible via GIS and Google Maps. Plus, documents are delivered via Qatar Post, eliminating the need for in-person visits.


6. Saudi Arabia: The Tax and Customs Authority (ZATCA) has extended its fines and penalties waiver initiative until 30 June 2025. Key benefits include:

- Waivers on late registrations, payment delays, and non-compliance with VAT e-invoicing.
- Instalment plans available for settling outstanding debts.
- Exclusions apply to tax evasion penalties and fines settled before the initiative.
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! These updates highlight the GCCs commitment to modernizing legal frameworks and enhancing individual rights. Exciting developments ahead!

Adebola Mercy Thomas

postsData.content:
𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐠𝐞𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐅𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐡.

One of my favorite verses is Colossians 3:23, which says, "𝑊ℎ𝑎𝑡𝑒𝑣𝑒𝑟 𝑦𝑜𝑢 𝑑𝑜, 𝑤𝑜𝑟𝑘 𝑎𝑡 𝑖𝑡 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝑎𝑙𝑙 𝑦𝑜𝑢𝑟 ℎ𝑒𝑎𝑟𝑡, 𝑎𝑠 𝑤𝑜𝑟𝑘𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑓𝑜𝑟 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝐿𝑜𝑟𝑑, 𝑛𝑜𝑡 𝑓𝑜𝑟 ℎ𝑢𝑚𝑎𝑛 𝑚𝑎𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑠."

This verse reminds me that my work is not just for my employer, but ultimately for God.

When I face challenges or difficult tasks, I can trust that God will give me the strength and wisdom to overcome them.

No matter the challenges we face, we can keep
going with faith, knowing that our work has a greater purpose.

Let’s give our best, not just for ourselves or others, but for God.

Keep pushing forward, your work matters more than you know.

P.S. Happy Sunday

comments.commentText: It’s easy to get discouraged, but knowing that our work has eternal value keeps me going.

postsData.commentAdded: Love this reminder! Our work can be a powerful testament to our faith. Lets keep striving for excellence with purpose! Happy Sunday! ✨

postsData.name:
Anil Narain अनिल नारायण Matai मटई
Anil Narain अनिल नारायण Matai मटई
postsData.content:
𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗱𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝘃𝗶𝗹 𝗿𝘂𝗹𝗲𝘀, 𝗯𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗲𝗳𝘀, 𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝘄𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗮𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗲?

Good and evil are not defined by rigid rules or inherited beliefs but by the resonance of our choices with the soul’s higher truth. Rules are reflections of collective morality, shaped by time and context. Beliefs are filters, often clouded by personal experience and cultural conditioning. Both can guide or mislead, but neither is an absolute compass.

The real measure of good and evil lies in the choices we make with awareness. Every choice vibrates with energy—some expand our consciousness toward compassion and harmony, while others contract it toward fear and separation. The Bhagavad Gita speaks of actions rooted in dharma (righteousness), not for personal gain but for the greater flow of life, as paths toward true goodness.

Good arises when choices align with love and unity; evil appears when choices fuel disconnection and suffering. Both forces are within us—testing and evolving our soul’s journey. Spiritual growth is about discerning these energies and choosing, again and again, what brings us closer to our divine nature.

In the end, it’s the heart’s whisper, not the world’s judgment, that defines what is truly good.

comments.commentText: Best words.

Deep stuff. Good and evil aren’t about rules; they’re about impact. 

Do your choices create connection or division? 
Growth or fear? That’s the real test.

postsData.commentAdded: Such a thought-provoking perspective! It’s a powerful reminder that our choices shape not just our path, but the world around us. 🌟

postsData.name:
Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
Business Development - The Missing Link Between Marketing & Sales - 540,000 Members Strong
postsData.content:
Not Everybody Is Cut Out To Be An Entrepreneur.

I get that.

It’s hard running a business.
It’s scary.

And most new businesses fail within the first 3 or 5 years.

There is a sense of stability having a job, even if it’s not such a great job.
It’s comfortable in corporate, especially at the executive levels.

If you’re good.

And yet, if you’re in your twenties, holding down a job that allows you to live but not much more,

And if all you do in your spare time (which you have a lot of) is mindless scrolling on social media and partying at night,

HOW THE HELL ARE YOU GOING TO GET AHEAD AND BECOME SOMETHING IN LIFE?

I’m not saying to quit your job and become an entrepreneur.

The only thing I’m saying is that you’re the boss of your spare time and you just might consider doing something with that time that will benefit you in the future.

Like maybe getting a 2nd job or start a small side hustle that will allow you to save, invest and accumulate wealth for the future.

Or learn something that will help you get ahead in your life.

I’m here to tell you that life isn’t fair, not all of us are dealt a great hand of cards at the table of Life.

Yet, what’s wonderful about life is that after the first hand that we’re dealt, with the right effort and action, we have the power to influence the next hands.

It is up to us.
And your life is up to you.

So go and do something about it.
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Taking charge of our spare time can be transformative. Its about seizing opportunities and investing in our future. 💪
